intro: Micropholis sanctae-rosae, commonly known as the sacred rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and its ornate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often in areas with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its unique properties and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable and somewhat rare botanical species.
